Registration

Advanced registration for the Python Conference has closed. You must now register on-site in San Jose.

You must make your own hotel reservations. The conference hotel is booked full, and so are some popular hotels in the area, but there are still rooms elsewhere in San Jose. October is peak season - make your hotel reservation as soon as possible!

Fee Structure

The following fees include breakfast, lunch and breaks. Tutorial fees include a reception on Tuesday night. Full conference fees include this reception as well as a banquet on Wednesday night.

Tuesday, October 14 Tutorials $200
Wed-Thurs, October 15-16 Technical Program $275
Full-time students $100
Friday, October 17 Developers' Day $75
Non PSA or Usenix members, add $50
Full-time student PSA membership (1 year) $25
For late registration (payment received after September 12), add $50

If you are not a PSA member at the time of the conference, you can choose to join the PSA or renew your membership.

Payment Options

You can pay by check drawn on a US bank, or by credit card (Visa, Mastercard, American Express, Diners Club). Cash payments can only be taken on site, and will incur the late fee (except for full-time students without a credit card or US bank account).

Because we are not set up with a secure Internet connection yet, we don't take your credit card number on-line. Instead, you can print out the confirmation email you receive and fax or snail-mail it to us with the desired information. (We are sharing registration resources with the IETF meetings, also organized by CNRI. When they support on-line payment, we will!)

Questions or Concerns?

If you have any questions or concerns, please can contact us via email to ipc6@python.org. For questions related to payments, you can also call at 703-620-8990.
